title: New extension template creates integration tests, but they are not run - or referenced in the top-level pom.xml

labels.name: area/devtools
labels.description: Issues/PR related to maven, gradle, platform and cli tooling/plugins

body:
### Describe the bug

When I create a new extension project using the mojo, an `integration-tests` project is created, but it's not run in normal builds. In fact, it's not referenced in the top-level project at all. This is the case even if I don't have the `-DwithoutTests` option which the instructions include in the default example.

```
holly@hcummins-mac tmp % mvn io.quarkus.platform:quarkus-maven-plugin:2.14.0.Final:create-extension -N -DgroupId=org.acme  -DextensionId=greeting-extension
[INFO] Scanning for projects...
Downloading from central: [...]
[INFO] 
[INFO] ------------------< org.apache.maven:standalone-pom >-------------------
[INFO] Building Maven Stub Project (No POM) 1
[INFO] --------------------------------[ pom ]---------------------------------
[INFO] 
[INFO] --- quarkus-maven-plugin:2.14.0.Final:create-extension (default-cli) @ standalone-pom ---

Detected layout type is 'standalone' 
Generated runtime artifactId is 'greeting-extension'

applying codestarts...
ðŸ“š  java
ðŸ”¨  maven
ðŸ“¦  quarkus-extension
ðŸš€  devmode-test
ðŸš€  extension-base
ðŸš€  integration-tests
ðŸš€  unit-test

-----------
 ðŸ‘  extension has been successfully generated in:
--> /Users/holly/Code/tmp/greeting-extension
```

If I run `mvn install` or `mvn verify`, no integration tests are run:
```
[INFO] 
[INFO] --- maven-jar-plugin:2.4:jar (default-jar) @ greeting-extension-deployment ---
[INFO] Building jar: /Users/holly/Code/tmp/greeting-extension/deployment/target/greeting-extension-deployment-1.0.0-SNAPSHOT.jar
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[INFO] Reactor Summary for Greeting Extension - Parent 1.0.0-SNAPSHOT:
[INFO] 
[INFO] Greeting Extension - Parent ........................ SUCCESS [  0.001 s]
[INFO] Greeting Extension - Runtime ....................... SUCCESS [  1.868 s]
[INFO] Greeting Extension - Deployment .................... SUCCESS [  3.212 s]
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[INFO] BUILD SUCCESS
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[INFO] Total time:  5.139 s
[INFO] Finished at: 2022-11-09T16:09:34Z
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
```

I don't think they could be run, because they're not referenced in the `pom.xml`:

```
holly@hcummins-mac greeting-extension % grep integration pom.xml 
holly@hcummins-mac greeting-extension %   
```

### Expected behavior

Older extensions either list `integration-tests` explicitly in the modules, or have this stanza in the pom.xml:

```
  <profiles>
    <profile>
      <id>it</id>
      <activation>
        <property>
          <name>performRelease</name>
          <value>!true</value>
        </property>
      </activation>
      <modules>
        <module>integration-tests</module>
      </modules>
    </profile>
  </profiles>
```  

### Actual behavior

There is no reference to the integration tests in the top-level pom, and they are not run from the top-level.

### How to Reproduce?

Steps to reproduce: 

```
mvn io.quarkus.platform:quarkus-maven-plugin:2.14.0.Final:create-extension -N -DgroupId=org.acme  -DextensionId=greeting-extension
cd greeting-extension
grep integration pom.xml
```
